data.title: Character Counting (CCCoC)
data.solution:
search_character = input()
row_count = int(input())

best_row = None
best_row_count = 0
for i in range(row_count):
    row = input()
    char_count = row.count(search_character)
    if char_count > best_row_count:
        best_row = row
        best_row_count = char_count

frequent_character = None
frequent_character_count = 0
for character in set(best_row):
    char_count = best_row.count(character)
    if char_count > frequent_character_count:
        frequent_character_count = char_count
        frequent_character = character
    elif char_count == frequent_character_count:
        if ord(character) < ord(frequent_character):
            frequent_character = character

print(f"{frequent_character} {frequent_character_count}")
data.statement:
Find the row that has the most of a given character. Then in that row find which character appears the most.

Characters are case sensitive.

If there is a tie for the row, pick the row which appears first.

If there is a tie for the most common character in the row, return the character with the lowest ascii ordinal value.

testCases.title: Row 2 has most 'a', b appears 3 times in that row
Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
Y
10
A
BbB
C
DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD
EY
F

YH
YI
JYYJYJJ

CodingAme

data.stubGenerator:
read searchCharacter:string(1)
read rowCount:int
loop rowCount read row:string(256)
write [most_frequent_character] [count]
data.inputDescription:
<<c>> character to find
<<n>> number of rows
data.outputDescription: Most common character in row. Number of times that character appears. These terms are separated by a space, not a newline.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Find the row that has the most of a given character. Then in that row find which character appears the most.

Characters are case sensitive.

If there is a tie for the row, pick the row which appears first.

If there is a tie for the most common character in the row, return the character with the lowest ascii ordinal value.
Input
c character to find
n number of rows
Output
Most common character in row. Number of times that character appears. These terms are separated by a space, not a newline.
Constraints
1 < n <= 10
0 < row length < 256
Example
Input
a
3
ac
aabbbcc
ad
Output
b 3
